natural solution: We know that we must perform the multiplication and division before we perform the addition and subtraction because of the order of operations.

We get \begin{align}182+3\cdot 7-64\div 2+27\div 3&=182+21-32+9.\end{align}Now, we write this as the sum of four numbers so that we can use the commutative and associative properties of addition to make the arithmetic easier.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem 
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = 182 + 3 * 7 - 64 / 2 + 27 / 3"
shows  "x = 180"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $182+3\cdot 7-64\div 2+27\div 3$. The final Answer is 180
 ### Proof
 We know that we must perform the multiplication and division before we perform the addition and subtraction because of the order of operations.
 We get \begin{align}182+3\cdot 7-64\div 2+27\div 3&=182+21-32+9.\end{align}Now, we write this as the sum of four numbers so that we can use the commutative and associative properties of addition to make the arithmetic easier.
 We have \begin{align}182+21-32+9&=182+21+(-32)+9 \\ &=182+(-32)+21+9 \\ &=(182+(-32))+(21+9) \\ &=(182-32)+(21+9) \\ &=150+30 \\ &=\boxed{180}.\end{align}
 *)
